question.text: Hydrogen has three isotopes <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mfenced separators="|"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mfenced><mo>.</mo></math> If the number of neutron(s) in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mi>A</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mfenced separators="|"><mi>B</mi></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mfenced></math> respectively, are <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mfenced separators="|"><mi mathvariant="normal">y</mi></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mi mathvariant="normal">z</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo></math> the sum of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mi mathvariant="normal">x</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mfenced separators="|"><mi mathvariant="normal">y</mi></mfenced></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><mi mathvariant="normal">z</mi></mfenced></math> is

solution.text:
Hydrogen has three isotopes
 
Isotopes Number of neutrons
Protium  1 1 H 0
Deutrium  1 2 H 1
Tritium   1 3 H 2

Hence, the sum of neutrons are 3.
